required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Clinical Markers for PARP Inhibitors-related Efficacy in Ovarian Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Real-world Study of Clinical Markers for PARP Inhibitors in Epithelial Ovarian Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC) is the most lethal gynecological malignancy. PARP inhibitors(PARPi) are an important progress in EOC treatment. The available evidence suggests that BRCAmt or HRD-positive is an effective biological marker for PARPi. However, in our previous clinical observation, it was found that the tumor burden may be the potential clinical markers PARPi. We intend to develop a real-world study to confirm the potential clinical markers and explore new clinical markers for PARPi.

detailed_description.textblock: This study intends to conduct a systematic real-world study to observe the relationship between the clinical characteristics of EOC patients and the efficacy of PARPi based on our existing research foundation and stratified analyse these correlations by BRCA and HRD status.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the proportion of participants achieving complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) as assessed by RECIST1.1.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time in months from the date of first study drug administration to the date of first documentation of progressive disease (PD) or death as assessed by RECIST1.1.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: DOR is defined as the time from the first date of response until the date of first documented progression.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: DCR is defined as the proportion of participants achieving complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) according to RECIST1.1.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE 5.0 to further describe safety and assess toxicities encountered with the use of the proposed treatment regimen in participants.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Ovarian cancer patients treated with PARP inhibitors
arm_group.description: PARP inhibitors therapy until disease progression

intervention.description: Ovarian cancer patients with PARP inhibitors according to the NCCN guideline and their instructions.
intervention.arm_group_label: Ovarian cancer patients treated with PARP inhibitors

study_pop.textblock: Ovarian cancer patients treated with PARP inhibitor in the real word.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Academic secretary of gynecological oncology Committee of Jiangsu anti cancer association

clinical_study.keyword: Ovarian caner, PARP inhibitor, Clinical marker

patient_data.ipd_description: Contact Prof. Chen and Dr. Ni for primary data.
